prompts.title: Paid Pilot Benchmarks
prompts.text: You are my research analyst for CartGuard. Find benchmark ranges for paid B2B pilots in compliance workflow software. I need typical pilot length, paid pilot pricing ranges, pilot-to-annual conversion rates, and strongest predictors of conversion. For each metric include value/range, date, geography, source URL, and confidence level. Use primary or highly credible sources and explicitly mark missing direct data.

prompts.title: Pilot Metrics That Actually Matter
prompts.text: You are my startup diligence researcher. Define the most credible pilot outcome metrics for a tool that flags missing documentation for APAC sellers entering EU marketplaces. We do recommendations only and no legal determinations. Output: metric definitions, formulas, baseline capture method, realistic 30-60 day target ranges, and anti-gaming checks. Include source-backed support with confidence scores.

prompts.title: Paid Pilot Objection Intelligence
prompts.text: You are my sales intelligence researcher. Identify top objections to paid pilots from China-based marketplace sellers entering Germany and from their agencies. Focus on objections around legal liability, false positives, integration effort, ROI uncertainty, and budget ownership. Output rebuttals, proof requirements, and confidence score for each objection pattern.

prompts.title: Market Size Reality Check
prompts.text: You are my fact-check analyst for CartGuard. We target China-based Amazon.de consumer electronics sellers entering Germany. Build a source-backed market size memo with no hype. Required output: 1) direct datasets that exist, 2) direct datasets that do not exist, 3) proxy stack with assumptions, 4) TAM/SAM/SOM ranges with confidence levels, 5) stage-safe claims vs non-stage-safe claims. For every number include value, unit, date, geography, source URL, and confidence. Prefer primary sources first (EU Commission, Eurostat, customs authorities, OECD, WTO, regulator docs).

prompts.title: Buyer And Budget Validation
prompts.text: You are my go-to-market research analyst for CartGuard. Determine who buys first in our wedge: ops, compliance/legal, or engineering. Output: 1) buyer map by role, 2) trigger events for purchase, 3) current spend substitutes (agencies, legal, VAT/EPR tools, in-house), 4) realistic ACV ranges for pilot and annual contracts, 5) objections that block closing. Use source-backed evidence and explicit confidence scores. Mark assumptions clearly.

prompts.title: Competition And Category Pressure
prompts.text: You are my competitive intelligence analyst for CartGuard. Analyze top competitors and alternatives for China->Germany Amazon.de electronics compliance workflows. Include VAT tools, EPR tools, PIM/PXM, AI governance tools, agencies, and in-house workflows. Required output: 1) competitor comparison table, 2) category leaders by segment, 3) where they can copy us fast, 4) where we can defend, 5) recommendation whether we are a new category or a feature in an existing category. Include only source-backed claims with confidence levels.

prompts.title: First 100 Target Accounts
prompts.text: You are my research ops analyst. Build a practical target-account strategy for CartGuard in our first wedge: China-based Amazon.de consumer electronics sellers (10-100 staff, 500-5,000 SKUs). Output: 1) where to find these companies, 2) ranking criteria, 3) qualification checklist, 4) red flags for disqualification, 5) expected partner channels that can accelerate intros (agencies, VAT/EPR firms, integrators). Keep it execution-focused and avoid generic advice.

prompts.title: Pilot Proof And ROI Questions
prompts.text: You are my startup diligence analyst. Define exactly what proof we need from 2-3 pilots to validate CartGuard viability. Output: 1) mandatory pilot metrics, 2) baseline data required before start, 3) success thresholds for go/no-go, 4) what claims become stage-safe after successful pilots, 5) kill criteria if pilots fail. Keep recommendations strict and measurable.
